arts.ttl: Fuming Steve Bruce fires 'could’ve changed eight or nine' shot after Birmingham City loss
arts.sum: “We got the goal after the break, we had opportunities, and the goalkeeper didn’t have a shot to save; however it’s all undone in the first half - that’s the frustration for me. “It was too easy for them, and we didn’t make it a cup tie for them until half time.

arts.ttl: Lyndon Dykes and Lukas Jutkiewicz fire Birmingham City into FA Cup 3rd round at Blackpool
arts.sum: Marc Leonard's corner wasn't cleared and when it ran to Brandon Khela, the Blues youngster had the intelligence to set Dykes, who picked out the far corner. Lyndon Dykes and Lukas Jutkiewicz, paired together in attack, both found the net in the first half before Jordan Rhodes replied for the Tangerines in the second period.

arts.ttl: Chris Davies discovers 'best case scenario' on Birmingham City fact finding mission
arts.sum: Davies has half an eye on Stockport County on Wednesday night before Blues visit Barnsley next weekend and then head back to Exeter in the last 32 of the EFL Trophy Tuesday week, so he used this tie as an opportunity to make wholesale alterations and hand minutes to various players on the fringes of the team in the League One campaign. Chris Davies declared Birmingham City's victory over Blackpool in the FA Cup second round on Sunday as the 'best case scenario', on an afternoon in which the Blues boss was able to make a host of changes, rest key first-team personnel and still oversee progression into the next round of the competition.

arts.ttl: Birmingham beat Blackpool to reach FA Cup third round
arts.sum: Watch the highlights as Birmingham City come back to haunt former manager Steve Bruce, beating Blackpool to reach the third round of the FA Cup.

arts.ttl: FA Cup 3rd round draw, start time and TV channel as Birmingham City go in the hat
arts.sum: This weekend marked the second round of the 2024-25 FA Cup and following the completion of the 20 ties taking place across the coming days, the draw for the next round will take place. Birmingham City will continue their FA Cup run in the New Year after booking their place in the third round of the competition.

arts.ttl: Birmingham beat former boss Steve Bruce’s Blackpool to reach FA Cup third round
arts.sum: Lyndon Dykes and Lukas Jutkiewicz struck in the first half for the visitors.

arts.ttl: Steve Bruce addresses awkward Aston Villa question ahead of Birmingham City reunion
arts.sum: Steve Bruce is unsure of the reception he will receive from Birmingham City fans when his Blackpool team host Blues in the FA Cup on Sunday lunchtime. However, to get there they will have to overcome a very familiar face in the Seasiders’ dug-out, their former boss Bruce who as well as having good times at St Andrew’s also managed fierce rivals Aston Villa.

arts.ttl: Sunday's FA Cup predictions including Blackpool vs. Birmingham
arts.sum: Sports Mole provides score predictions and previews for all of today's FA Cup fixtures, including Blackpool vs. Birmingham.

arts.ttl: Chris Davies reveals what Birmingham City 'people' think about Steve Bruce
arts.sum: The 39-year-old paid a fulsome tribute: "I've huge respect for Steve, as a player and a manager, what he's achieved," Davies said. Chris Davies insists Steve Bruce remains a respected name at Birmingham City as the rookie manager prepares to face one of the most experienced in English football.

arts.ttl: Leonard, Dykes, Yokoyama - Predicted Birmingham City XI as Chris Davies outlines his intention - Joseph Chapman - Birmingham Live
arts.sum: The Blues boss, who inspired his side to a rapid response in the week as they conquered Exeter City following the disappointment at Shrewsbury Town, has another game coming on Wednesday night and then Blues are in action again next Saturday, as December begins how it will end - with a congested schedule. Blues head to Blackpool in the second round of the FA Cup on Sunday still missing a number of senior personnel through injury, but Davies intends to ring the changes regardless.
